meanings.definition: The act of assessing something too highly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: Her overassessment of her own abilities led to disappointment.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's overassessment of the student's work resulted in unfair grades.
meanings.sent3: His overassessment of his cooking skills made him believe he could open a restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The overassessment of the situation made it seem more complicated than it actually was.
meanings.sent5: The overassessment of the house's value caused the buyer to overpay.

meanings.definition: An excessive evaluation or judgment of something.
meanings.sent1: The overassessment of the project's importance delayed its completion.
meanings.sent2: His overassessment of the movie's quality made him reluctant to watch it.
meanings.sent3: The overassessment of the dog's intelligence led to unrealistic expectations.
meanings.sent4: The overassessment of the risk made them overly cautious.
meanings.sent5: The overassessment of the dessert's sweetness left everyone with a sugar rush.
